xsd:annotation.xsd:documentation: status info of the processing of a service's business functions is in this type.
0 for nominal status
File location that also includes a file type information so that a file viewer can be associated
URL of the file : for the GML viewer it must be a http URL
String that is used to determine which viewer will be used e.g GML
Data to be displayed and also embedded type information so that a viewer can be associated
content to be displayed
String that is used to determine which viewer will be used e.g GML
Common input for all business functions
contains common info of a service business function
contains status info about the processing of a service's business functions
Represent a file URL, file which can be displayed by a MASS viewer
Input parameters for the present operation
type of the input message of a service's processPresent soap operation
type of the ouput message of a service's present soap operation
input message element for the processPresent SOAP request
output message element for the processPresent SOAP response
input parameters for the Search operation.
type of the input message of a service's processPresent SOAP request
type of the retrieved data
standard information that contains the specific output of a Search or Present operation
type of the ouput message of a service's process Search soap operation
type of the information of a service's Search SOAP response
element that contains the CollectionIds that will be searched for
element that represents the needed information to make a search
element that represents the collection of retrieved data from a Search or a Present
element that contains the Search/Present Results
document element of message sent to the Catalogue Search Operation
document element of message responsed by the the Catalogue Search Operation
service's rfq input parameters are in this type. Normally, the service provider will redefine this type to add more service-specific info
service's rfq results are in this type. Normally, the service provider will redefine this type to add more service-specific info.
service's rfq can return more than one result.
type of the input message of a service's sendRFQ soap operation
type of the output message of a service's sendRFQ soap operation
type of the input message of a service's getRFQResult soap operation
type of the output message of a service's getRFQResult soap operation
type of the input message of a service's processRFQ soap operation
type of the output message of a service's processRFQ SOAP response
type of the input message of the returnRFQResult SOAP request sent to the MASS server
type of the output message of the returnRFQResult SOAP response hosted on MASS server
element that contains a service's RFQ input parameters
element contains a service's RFQ results
element contains one RFQ result
service's order input parameters are in this type. Normally, the service provider will redefine this type to add more service-specific info.
service's order results are in this type. Normally, the service provider will redefine this type to add more service-specific info.
type of the input message of a service's sendOrder soap operation
type of the output message of a service's sendOrder soap operation
type of the input message of a service's getOrderResult soap operation
type of the output message of a service's getOrderResult soap operation
type of the input message of the returnOrderResult soap operation hosted on MASS server
type of the output message of the returnOrderResult soap operation hosted on MASS server
type of the input message of a service's process Order soap operation
type of the output message of a service's process Order soap operation
contains a service's order input parameters
contains a service's order result
type for input xml message used to do search on multiple catalogues
type for ouput xml message resulted from a multiple search
GML v2 Schema for AOI features.

annotation.documentation: GML Feature schema. Copyright (c) 2001 OGC, All Rights Reserved.

An abstract feature provides a set of common properties. A concrete feature type must derive from this type and specify additional properties in an application schema. A feature may optionally possess an identifying attribute ('fid').
This abstract base type just makes the boundedBy element mandatory for a feature collection.
A feature collection contains zero or more featureMember elements.
A simple geometry property encapsulates a geometry element. Alternatively, it can function as a pointer (simple-type link) that refers to a remote geometry element.

An instance of this type (e.g. a featureMember) can either enclose or point to a feature (or feature collection); this type can be restricted in an application schema to allow only specified features as valid participants in the association. When serving as a simple link that references a remote feature instance, the value of the gml:remoteSchema attribute can be used to locate a schema fragment that constrains the target instance.
Bounding shapes--a Box or a null element are currently allowed.
Encapsulates a single point to represent position, location, or centerOf properties.
Encapsulates a single polygon to represent coverage or extentOf properties.
Encapsulates a single LineString to represent centerLineOf or edgeOf properties.
Encapsulates a MultiPoint element to represent the following discontiguous geometric properties: multiLocation, multiPosition, multiCenterOf.
Encapsulates a MultiLineString element to represent the following discontiguous geometric properties: multiEdgeOf, multiCenterLineOf.
Encapsulates a MultiPolygon to represent the following discontiguous geometric properties: multiCoverage, multiExtentOf.
Encapsulates a MultiGeometry element.

If a bounding shape is not provided for a feature collection, explain why. Allowable values are: innapplicable - the features do not have geometry unknown - the boundingBox cannot be computed unavailable - there may be a boundingBox but it is not divulged missing - there are no features
GML Geometry schema. Copyright (c) 2001 OGC, All Rights Reserved.
This abstract base type for geometry collections just makes the srsName attribute mandatory.

These attributes can be attached to any element, thus allowing it to act as a pointer. The 'remoteSchema' attribute allows an element that carries link attributes to indicate that the element is declared in a remote schema rather than by the schema that constrains the current document instance.

An instance of this type (e.g. a geometryMember) can either enclose or point to a primitive geometry element. When serving as a simple link that references a remote geometry instance, the value of the gml:remoteSchema attribute can be used to locate a schema fragment that constrains the target instance.
Restricts the geometry member to being a Point instance.
Restricts the geometry member to being a LineString instance.
Restricts the geometry member to being a Polygon instance.
A Point is defined by a single coordinate tuple.
A LineString is defined by two or more coordinate tuples, with linear interpolation between them.
A LinearRing is defined by four or more coordinate tuples, with linear interpolation between them; the first and last coordinates must be coincident.
The Box structure defines an extent using a pair of coordinate tuples.
A Polygon is defined by an outer boundary and zero or more inner boundaries which are in turn defined by LinearRings.

A geometry collection must include one or more geometries, referenced through geometryMember elements. User-defined geometry collections that accept GML geometry classes as members must instantiate--or derive from--this type.
A MultiPoint is defined by one or more Points, referenced through pointMember elements.
A MultiLineString is defined by one or more LineStrings, referenced through lineStringMember elements.
A MultiPolygon is defined by one or more Polygons, referenced through polygonMember elements.
Represents a coordinate tuple in one, two, or three dimensions.

Coordinates can be included in a single string, but there is no facility for validating string content. The value of the 'cs' attribute is the separator for coordinate values, and the value of the 'ts' attribute gives the tuple separator (a single space by default); the default values may be changed to reflect local usage.

xsd:annotation.xsd:documentation: This represent the targetPart elements within the Z39.50- CIP- Order ExtendedRequest
Indicates the type of operation that is requested to be performed for the order request. It has associated a list of enumeratives defining 5 possible kinds of order requests
This level corresponds to the OrderDescriptor level of MUIS-C and to Detail Order Level of DE.

It maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderId' and DE implicit order 'Project+OrdCtr+RefDuID'. It coincides with OHS_OrderId for order directed from OHS towards CUS (i.e. composed with Account+sequential number internal to the account for MUIS and N/A for DE Interface). It coincides again with OHS_OrderId for order directed from OHS towards PROMISE ( i.e. composed with Account+MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderId' for MUIS, Project+OrdCtrDuID for DE).

Specify if the update of the status shall be notified automatically or manually. It shall be used to implement DE functionality of requesting a status. For MUIS-C the option will always be set to automatic with value 'OGC_interface'
Only the userId and the Billing.CustomerReference are used in this context. That is because only the shipping address is needed, not at this level but at DeliveryUnit level
It maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'UserId' parameter
It maps the DE #UORD 'Project' parameter and the MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderAccount' parameter.
Counts the Provider Order Status files sent to DE for this detail order
This type maps mailny MUIS-C OrderDescriptor structure and DE #DORD (Detailed Order definition) interface.
It contains identificators of the order
Always ESA/UOS for MEH purposes
List of Delivery Units associated to the order
At this level MUIS-C maps OrderDescriptor 'OrderPrice', 'OrderListPrice' and 'OrderExpectedPrice'. DE maps only the expectedPrice in the #DORD interface.
Maps the MUIS-C OrderDescriptor LatestCancelDate. NOt present in DE interfaces.
it Maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderType'. Not used in DE interfaces.
It maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor "OrderClass"
Scope of the order. Not present in MUIS-C. Used in DE within #DORD to improve service ("Scope").
It maps the DE #DORD 'Appl Type' parameter

The System from which the order has been posted. It maps the MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderSource[-CollectionId]' and DE UORD 'Prov' parameter. The CollectionId is a MUIS-C parameter given within TargetService compound paramater. The given enumerative list is extensible.
Maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor "OrderDateTime" and DE #DORD "Date/Time:".
It maps MUIS-C OrderItem 'OrderStatus' and 'OrderStatusDescription' parameters

It maps information depending on the interfaces: 1) customer2orderDesk 2) orderDesk2Customer 3) orderDesk2Processing 4) processing2OrderDesk. It maps MUIS-C "OrderUserRemarks" in OrderDescriptor and DE #UORD 'Remarks'
Logical condition to be applied to all order items. Present only in MUIS-C OrderDescriptor
True if DeliveryUnits can be delivered separately. Present in MUIS-C OrderDescriptor and in DE #DORD interface ("PD").

Different from 100 if partial fullfillment is acceptable for the user. Allowed values are from 0 to 100, 100 means MUIS-C 'FALSE' (100% have to be fulfilled, no prtial fulfilment accepted), any other value means MUIS-C 'TRUE'. In DE it expresses the minimum percentage of completeness of the order to consider the order as fulfilled.

It mapping depends on usage: 1) customer (DE, cat1) to OHS: customerContactPoint (DE #DORD 'CD' (Prov_Who)) 2) OHS 2 customer: orderDeskContactPoint (DE #DORD 'SD' (Supplier Deputy)) 3) OHS 2 processing: (CUS/PROMISE/ENVISAT): orderDeskContactPoint 4) processing 2 OHS: processingContactPoint
Describes a logical condition to be applied to all order items. It maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor "OrderCondition"
It maps the DE #AREA 'Radius' parameter
It maps DE #AREA Area(s) (Cluster_Area_Name). It is not used in MUIS-C
It maps DE #AREA Area(s) (Area_Name). It is not used in MUIS-C
Split MUIS-C SPECIFIC_CONDITIONS single string at each '\n' encountered defining multiple strings.
Split MUIS-C CORRELATION_CONDITIONS string at '\n'

This section maps MUIS-C DeliveryUnitDescriptor structure. DE interface does not have a specific structure mapping this section and most of the relevant information contained here can be found in #DORD interface.
Identifier of the DeliveryUnit. It maps MUIS-C DeliveryUnitDescriptor "DeliveryUnitId" and DE #DORD "Ref DuId#".
At this level MUIS-C maps delivery firmPrice, listPrice and expectedPrice. DE does not maps this information at this level.

Represents the delivery method requested for the DeliveryUnit. It maps MUIS-C DeliveryUnitdescriptor "DeliveryMethod" plus the relevant UserInformation (DeliveryAddress / DeliveryEmailAddress / etc..). In DE this information are presented at #DORD level for what concern the information related to FTP address an mail / email address, at #ITEM level for what concern the delivery method that shall be used.

Information related to billing method. It maps MUIS-C DeliveryUnitdescriptor PaymentMethod plus related payment ionformation such as Credit card info. DE does not have this kind of information in its interfaces.
It maps MUIS-C DeliveryUnitDescriptor 'DeliveryUnitStatus' and 'DeliveryUnitStatusDescription' parameters
Its mapping depends on the interface: 1)customer2OrderDesk 2)orderDesk2Customer 3)orderDesk2Processing 4)processing2OrderDesk. With the first meaning it maps also DE #DORD 'Remarks'
Date by when the delivery unit has to be delivered. It maps MUIS-C DeliveryUnitDescriptor "LatestAcceptedDeliveryDate" and DE #ITEM "Deadline"
Additional info to be inserted on the physical package. Used only by DE #DORD interface.
It maps DE #ITEM 'SL' (ServiceLevel)
Priority of the order. It maps MUIS-C OrderItem "OrderItemPriority" and DE #ITEM "Pr".
If present it will be passed to CUS in order to manage multiple addresses for the same user.
If present it will be passed to CUS in order to manage multiple addresses for the same user.
Identify the specific package. It maps MUIS-C PackageDescriptor PackageId. DE does not have the package level within its interface but it maps DE #ITEM 'Set'.
It is not used for MEH.
Identification of a medium. It maps MUIS-C 'DeliveryMedium' and 'MediumFormattingOption' in OrderItemDescriptor and DE #ITEM "Med"
Package price
Its mapping depends on the interface: 1)customer2orderDesk 2)orderDesk2Customer 3)orderDesk2Processing 4)processing2OrderDesk
It maps DE #DORD 'Additional media label'.
It maps MUIS-C PackageDescriptor 'packageCopies' and the number that could be inside DE #ITEM 'Set' parameter
It identifies the ordered product.
It contains delivery options for the product.
It specifies the processing options to be applied on the product before delivery.
It specifies the selection of the scene from the product that is to be delivered.
It indicates the status of the order item
Acquisition station code. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "AcquisitionStation" and DE #ITEM "Station(s)"
Indication of the mission phase. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "MissionPhaseId" and last char of DE #ITEM "Mission"
Status of the product: It maps MUIS-C OrderItem "ProductStatus"
Source (terminalCollectionId/Supplier) for the product. It maps MUIS-C OrderItemDescriptor "ProductSource"
It maps DE #ITEM 'RejC' and 'RejN'
It contains an customerOrderItemId
It contains an OHS_OrderItemId
Suggested facility
Its mapping depends on the interface: 1)customer2OrderDesk 2)orderDesk2Customer 3)orderDesk2Processing 4)processing2OrderDesk
Quality information. It maps DE #DORD 'ICUD D' (Quality_Level)
It maps the DE #UORD 'User Id' parameter and the MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'CustomerId'
Not needed by MUIS-C. Used by DE in #DORD
Not needed in MUIS-C at OrderDescriptor level. used by DE #DORD interface.
Not needed in MUIS-C. used by DE #DORD interface. For its definition the MUIS-C related attribute length has been used.
Telephone Number
Not used at this level
It maps DE #DORD 'VAT' parameter
A=Absolute, S=Seconds
A=Absolute, S=Seconds
The unit for radius is the kilometer ('km')
Organisation Name
Department or Section
It maps the MUIS-C DeliveryUnitDescriptor 'DeliveryUnitId' parameter
It is the ProcessingDeliveryUnitId. The identificator assigned by processing facility.
It maps MUIS-C DeiveryAddress 'c/o' and InvoiceAddress 'c/o'.
Telephone Number
Maps different types of attachment supported by DE
Scene selected over a browse image
It is an extensible list
ftp URL containing also DE interface directory, username, password information
Not used for MEH
Not used for MEH
It maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderId' and DE #DORD 'Ref DuId#' parameter
It identifies the order in OHS
It maps the MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderUserReference' (it is the end user orderId)
It maps the MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OrderName' parameter
It is identificator assigned by processing facility.
It map the MUIS-C OrderItemDescriptor "OrderItemId" and the DE #ITEM "Item".
It is processingOrderItemId, the identifier of the orderItem inside the processing system.
It maps MUIS-C Status
it maps MUIS-C StatusDescription
It maps the MUIS-C status and DE #ITEM 'St' (Status)
It maps MUIS-C OrderItemDescriptor "OrderItemStatusDescription" and DE #ITEM "RejN" (RejectionNote)
Date/Time of this status change
It maps the MUIS-C PackageDescriptor PackageId' parameter
Its format is: [+|-]nn.nn
Its format is: nnn.nn
ISO-3166 2-char is used (even if 3 chars are available)
Price Information. It maps both MUIS-C price (Order, DeliveryUnit, Package or OrderItem) and DE (#DORD, #ITEM) price and royalty information.
It maps MUIS-C OrderDescriptor 'OfferExpirationDate' parameter
It contains the size of the product in bytes. It maps the MUIS-C parameter "DataSize" in OrderItemDescriptor
It contains the MUIS-C "Format" Processing Option
It contains the MUIS-C "Compression" Processing Option.
Not Used
Product type code. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "ProductCodeId" and DE #ITEM "Product Code"
Unique code for the satellite/mission. It maps the MUIS-C Acquisitiondescriptor 'Satellite' (PlatformId,SatelliteNumber) and DE #ITEM 'Mission'
Identification of the sensor. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "SensorId" and the second part of DE #ITEM "Mission"
Absolute orbit number. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "Orbit" and DE #ITEM "Orbit"
WRS Track number. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "Track" and DE #ITEM "Track"
WRS frame number. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "Frame" and DE #ITEM "Frame"
Start date/time for the temporal coverage. It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor "TemporalCoverage(Start)" and DE #ITEM "Date"
Selected scene centre coordinates.
It maps MUIS-C AcquisitionDescriptor 'ProductOrderId' and DE #ITEM 'Scene'
It maps DE #DORD 'TITLE' parameter
It maps DE #DORD 'FIRST_NAME' parameter
It maps DE #DORD 'LAST_NAME' parameter
Used only by MUIS-C
It maps DE #ITEM 'RejC' and 'RejN'
Scene selected over a browse image
It maps #ITEM 'Lat' and 'Long' (Centre Latitude and Longitude of floating frame) and the MUIS-C OrderItemDescriptor 'OrderItemSceneCentre'
(e.g. 'quarter number')
It maps DE #ITEM 'DN'
Used for multi-scenes product. It maps DE #ITEM 'NOF' (Number_Of_frames)
The unit for lowAltitude is the Meter ('m')
The unit for highAltitude is the Meter ('m')
List of valid actions allowed

xsd:enumeration.value: Only at end of last observation

xsd:annotation.xsd:documentation: List of systems from which the order can be posted. This list is extensible
List of Valid Statii for the Delivery Unit as defined in MUIS-C
List of valid Pass Direction Values
List of ProductCodeId (to be provided by ESA)
Lit of valid Product Status supported

annotation.documentation: This schema provides the XLink attributes for general use.

The 'show' attribute is used to communicate the desired presentation of the ending resource on traversal from the starting resource; it's value should be treated as follows: new - load ending resource in a new window, frame, pane, or other presentation context replace - load the resource in the same window, frame, pane, or other presentation context embed - load ending resource in place of the presentation of the starting resource other - behavior is unconstrained; examine other markup in the link for hints none - behavior is unconstrained

The 'actuate' attribute is used to communicate the desired timing of traversal from the starting resource to the ending resource; it's value should be treated as follows: onLoad - traverse to the ending resource immediately on loading the starting resource onRequest - traverse from the starting resource to the ending resource only on a post-loading event triggered for this purpose other - behavior is unconstrained; examine other markup in link for hints none - behavior is unconstrained

xsd:annotation.xsd:documentation: Inventory Search Request Root Element as defined in the CG_QueryRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0).
ISO 19115 short name of element Start and End Date element.
Start date in ISO 8601 format. This element can contain: date (format CCYY-MM-DD) or dateTime (format CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)
End data in ISO 8601 format. This element can contain: date (format CCYY-MM-DD) or dateTime (format CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

This field specified the search space for the query request. TargetService Root Element. Its name comes from the CG_QueryRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0). For this element, use the following syntax: Provider.Facility.CollectionId where Provider, Facility and CollectionId elements are defined by the data provider.

This field identifies: in the query request, the first result set entry to be returned in the query response; in the query response, the last item in the result set that was returned in the retrieved data set as defined in the CG_QueryRequest and the CG_QueryResponse of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0).

This field is only valid when results are requested to be returned directly in the query response. This parameter informs the server which of the attributes in the result set elements are to be returned to the client as defined in the CG_QueryRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0). This field can take on only the following values: brief, summary, full and browse.
ISO 19130 Frame field.
ISO 19130 Track field.
Orbit field as defined in CEOS CIP 2.4 as "OrbitNumber" element.
Inventory Retrieve Request Root Element as defined in the CG_PresentRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0).
Product Identifier element. It is limited to a single value with an attribute named operator. ISO 19115 short name of element 24 (Identification Information).
ISO 19115 shortName of element 360 (Citation and responsible party information)

This represents a short name of the Platform as defined in the FGDC extensions for Remote Sensing Data document as the shortName of the "Platform_Short_Name" element. This element can take on only the CEOS CIP valid Value for the Platform element.

This represents a letter and/or a numbers applied to the platform as defined in the FGDC extensions for Remote Sensing Data document as the shortName of the "Platform_Serial_Identifier" element. This element can take on only the CEOS CIP valid Value for the Platform element.

SensorId element as defined in the FGDC extensions for Remote Sensing Data document as "Instrument_Short_Name" element. This element can take on only the CEOS CIP valid Value for the SensorId element.
ISO 19115 shortName of element 360 (Citation and responsible party information).
Inventory Search Response Root Element as defined in the CG_QueryResponse of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0).
ISO 19115 metadata root element 1 (MD_Metadata).
number of entries in the results set as defined in the CG_QueryResponse of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0).
This parameter conveys the success or failure of the query request as defined in the CG_QueryResponse of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0).

It maps gml211 Coordinates definition. It models a list of points coordinates according the following format: points are separated by blank, point's coordinates lat and long are separated by comma (,). The decimal point (.) is used to separate decimals.
Not null string type.
Character string type.
Type of a longitude value.
Type of a latitude value.
Type of a cloudCoveragePerc value.
Type of a presentation element.

Type of the status element. The status is a code list for representing the current status of a resource or request. The valid values for this type come from the CG_QueryResponse of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0)
Type of Role element.
Type of a IdStatus element.
Type of a degree value.
Type of contentInfo element. Allowed value is 001=image.
Type of OrbitDirectionEnum element.
Type of Polarisation element.
Type of FullSceneEnum element.
Type of coordinates element.
Type of the searchRequest element.
Query Element Root request.

Type of data to be returned in a query response message and the behaviour of the message response as defined in the CG_QueryRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0)

This field indicates the maximum number of the result set entries to be returned in the query response. Its name comes from the CG_QueryRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0)

This field is only valid when results are requested to be returned directly in the query response. This parameter informs the server which of the attributes in the result set elements are to be returned to the client as defined in the CG_QueryRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0). This field can take on only the following values: brief, summary, full and browse.

This field specified the search space for the query request. TargetService Root Element. Its name comes from the CG_QueryRequest of the OpenGIS - Catalog Interface Implementation Specification (Version 1.0) document. For this element, use the following syntax: Provider.Facility.CollectionId where Provider, Facility and CollectionId elements are defined by the data provider.
Type of the simpleQuery element.

Spatial and temporal condition define as per ISO19115 element 45 (extent). The Spatial Condition is limited to single BoundingRectangle with an attribute named operator. The Temporal Coverage is limited to single temporal range.
ISO 19115 metadata element 336 (geographicElement).
ISO 19115 metadata element 343 (EX_GeographicBoundingBox)
ISO 19115 metadata element 337 (temporalElement).

Start date in ISO 8601 format. This element can contain: date (format CCYY-MM-DD).
End data in ISO 8601 format. This element can contain: date (format CCYY-MM-DD).

type of the satelliteExtendedConditions element.
plaInsIdCondition Identification element Root. This element is limited to a single value with an attribute named operator.

This represents a short name of the Platform as defined in the FGDC extensions for Remote Sensing Data document as the shortName of the "Platform_Short_Name" element. This element can take on only the CEOS CIP valid Value for the Platform element.

This represents a letter and/or a numbers applied to the platform as defined in the FGDC extensions for Remote Sensing Data document as the shortName of the "Platform_Serial_Identifier" element. This element can take on only the CEOS CIP valid Value for the Platform element.

This represents a short name of the Platform as defined in the FGDC extensions for Remote Sensing Data document as the shortName of the "Platform_Short_Name" element. This element can take on only the CEOS CIP valid Value for the Platform element.

This represents a letter and/or a numbers applied to the platform as defined in the FGDC extensions for Remote Sensing Data document as the shortName of the "Platform_Serial_Identifier" element. This element can take on only the CEOS CIP valid Value for the Platform element.

This represents the ProductStatus element. Its name comes from ISO 19115 document as "Identification Information" (shortName of the 28 element). 008 (potential): visible/potential (can be acquired, but is not planned); 006 (required): planning of these data has been requested; 005 (planned): planned; 007 (underDevelopment): acquired; 001 (completed): produced (the relevant level of this item has been produced and is readily available).
